intro: Tragopogon pratensis subsp. orientalis, commonly known as the oriental goat's beard, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive leaf morphology. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, thriving in temperate climates with well-drained soil. Its leaves are basal, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs, while the inflorescence consists of a yellow disk surrounded by pale blue to purple ray florets. The species is known for its ornamental value and has been introduced to other regions as a garden plant.
